meanings.definition: Occurring before ethical principles are established.
meanings.sent1: The preethical decision was made without thinking about right or wrong.
meanings.sent2: It is important to consider preethical implications before making a choice.
meanings.sent3: The preethical dilemma led to an unexpected outcome.
meanings.sent4: Her preethical behavior raised eyebrows among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The preethical nature of the situation made it difficult to navigate.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to actions or decisions made before ethical considerations are taken into account.
meanings.sent1: The preethical approach focused solely on practicality.
meanings.sent2: He regretted his preethical actions once he realized the consequences.
meanings.sent3: The preethical choice seemed logical at the time.
meanings.sent4: Their preethical behavior set a dangerous precedent.
meanings.sent5: The preethical nature of the decision clouded their judgment.
